raw_text: In comparison, in (Yamada and Knight, 2002), which was a phrasal structure based statistical MT system for Chinese to English translation, the Bleu score reported for short sentences (less than 14 words) is 0.099 to 0.102
clean_text: In comparison, in (Yamada and Knight, 2002), which was a phrasal structure based statistical MT system for Chinese to English translation, the Bleu score reported for short sentences (less than 14 words) is 0.099 to 0.102.

raw_text: While (Yamada and Knight, 2002) represent syntactical information in the decoding process through a series of transformation operations, we operate directly at the phrase level
clean_text: While (Yamada and Knight, 2002) represent syntactical information in the decoding process through a series of transformation operations, we operate directly at the phrase level.

raw_text: The syntactically supervised model has been found to outperform the IBM word-level alignment models of Brown et al (1993) for translation by Yamada and Knight (2002)
clean_text: The syntactically supervised model has been found to outperform the IBM word-level alignment models of Brown et al (1993) for translation by Yamada and Knight (2002).

raw_text: (Yamada and Knight, 2002) propose a syntax-based decoder that restrict word reordering based on reordering operations on syntactic parse-trees of the input sentence
clean_text: (Yamada and Knight, 2002) propose a syntax-based decoder that restrict word reordering based on reordering operations on syntactic parse-trees of the input sentence.

raw_text: Yamada and Knight (2002) presents a decoder for syntax-based MT that uses so-called phrasal translation units that correspond to blocks
clean_text: Yamada and Knight (2002) presents a decoder for syntax-based MT that uses so-called phrasal translation units that correspond to blocks.

raw_text: As an alternative option to our verb-modifier experiments, structured language models (Chelba and Jelinek, 1998) might be considered to improve clause coherence, until full-featured syntax-based MT models (Yamada and Knight (2002), Eisner (2003), Chiang (2005) among many others )aretested when translating to morphologically rich languages
clean_text: As an alternative option to our verb-modifier experiments, structured language models (Chelba and Jelinek, 1998) might be considered to improve clause coherence, until full-featured syntax-based MT models (Yamada and Knight (2002), Eisner (2003), Chiang (2005) among many others) are tested when translating to morphologically rich languages.

raw_text: For reasons of speed, Yamada and Knight (2002) limited training to sentences of length 30, and were able to use only one fifth of the available Chinese-English parallel corpus
clean_text: For reasons of speed, Yamada and Knight (2002) limited training to sentences of length 30, and were able to use only one fifth of the available Chinese-English parallel corpus.

raw_text: One way to approach reordering is by extending the translation model, either by adding extra models, such as lexicalized (Koehn et al, 2005) or discriminative (Zens and Ney, 2006) reordering models or by directly modelling reordering in hierarchical (Chiang, 2007) or syntactical translation models (Yamada and Knight, 2002)
clean_text: One way to approach reordering is by extending the translation model, either by adding extra models, such as lexicalized (Koehn et al, 2005) or discriminative (Zens and Ney, 2006) reordering models or by directly modelling reordering in hierarchical (Chiang, 2007) or syntactical translation models (Yamada and Knight, 2002).
